intro: Hebeandra euonymoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in open areas such as cliffs and rocky outcrops. Hebeandra euonymoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
